p: In order to better compare allelic richness between populations and species, we used HP-Rare [ 28] to standardize population sample sizes. HP-Rare employs a rarefaction method to estimate allelic richness based on the smallest or other chosen sample size in a study. We ran the software on all populations with more than seven individuals from all three species. Total populations meeting or exceeding this threshold were seven from L. tumana, two from A. linda, and 23 from P. californica. We used SMOGD [ 29] to estimate values of G ST, Gâ€™ ST, and D est for both modern and historic populations, and to calculate 95% confidence ranges for these estimates.
